captions.text:
"One size fits all" on
different body types

"One size fits all" stores
are popping up everywhere
We decided to try on a few of their items
- I guess I know not a lot
of things are gonna fit.
Height 5'11, Size 14/16, Sheridan

- I'm not really sure
what to expect with this.
Height 5'9, Size 4/6, Lara

- Yeah, I think it's just
gonna be really silly.
Height 5'3, Size 0, Allison

- One size fits all hats
don't even fit all people
Height 5'3, Size 18, Kristin
- Everybody is so different that
you could be small up here,
big down here, I don't know.
Height 5'6, Size 6/8, Candace
Donilyn Tank

- I'm apparently going
to fit this over my head.
We got this.

There's just nothing
good about this for me.
- This isn't gonna fit everyone.
It doesn't fit me.

Honestly, this just makes
me wanna go like this.
- The fits okay, it not great, it's fine.

- My mom used to say
something that was like,

"I'm a size two sausage
in a size one casing."
and that's what I feel like right now.
- I can't pulling anything.

There's no where to escape,
this is basically a bra.
Emilia Skirt
- Let's get this.
So short.
This is one size but,
doesn't stretch too much.
- Yeah, I wouldn't wear this.
It just doesn't fit me.
I can see through it.
- This is the perfect skirt for work.
Yeah, this skirts terrible.
I don't who this would fit.
Like who? Who would this fit?
- Well, it fits.
Just kidding, it's awful.
I hate everything about it.

It's giving me the biggest
wedgie I've ever had.
Layla Hoodie
- Real talk, this fits super well.
- It is delightfully comfortable.
It fits, I think I look pretty good.

- I'm no a huge fan of
how short it is here,
just because I have a longer torso.
- It fits me pretty well,

but I feel maybe if
you're shorter or smaller,
it's just gonna kinda eat you alive.
- This is the MVP.
It's the best, everybody loves it.
Jada Dress

- I feel like one wrong move
and I could reveal myself.
The back is little bit revealing
for a workplace environment.
- It's not the worst thing in the world.
Again, it's like a little bit short on me.
- But realistically though
this is where, I mean...
This is where my chest is supposed to be.
This may not be flattering
but it should be able to get over my body.
Jersey has one job
and that's to get on everyone's body.
- I'm gonna do this.
This is just not happening.
I'm giving up with this.
- I put on this dress and I was like,
"Oh, hell yeah, like I can fit in this."
But it's kinda sad because I shouldn't...
I don't know, you know what I mean?
They're like making me feel bad
if I don't fit in something that's
obviously way too small for
90% of the human race.
How does it make you feel?
- One size doesn't fit all which
I pretty much knew going into this

but it's kind of a real
eye opener when your

trying on all these
clothes on your own body
and just kind of putting it out there.

- Clothes shopping when you're
a little bit bigger is hard.

I feel like this is just
kind of one step further
and that it makes people who are
actually, probably quite small feel
like that there are clothing options
that are shut off to them.
- It's a weird thing that we're...

As a society, we're just
so obsessed with size.

We're so obsessed with
how thin someone is,
how tall someone is.
- I never really thought about how bad it
could make me and everyone else feel.

You know, the goal is
to celebrate all sizes.

- When I didn't fit into
it, it felt like something

was wrong with my body and
I think you could definitely
hurt younger women

that grow up feeling like
they need to fit in one size.

title: "One Size Fits All" On Different Body Types

The employees at Brandy Melville are so fuckin' rude it's not even funny.

comments.author: ladynoge

comments.text:
One size fits all shouldn't even be a thing because there is literally 
nothing that can fit all bodies unless it's the size of a mattress cover, 
and that wouldn't exactly be flattering so what's the point? clothes have 
sizes for a reason﻿
comments.author: King Kyler

comments.text:
this video is honestly so important. when i try on a clothing item thats 
"one size fits all" and its too small on me, i feel bad about my body. 
cause then i feel like it should be called "one size fits all except for 
madison", when in reality i'm average sized for a 5'2 fifteen year old. 
which basically means that "one size fits all" is either going to be too 
small or too big for most people, and will only fit maybe 15% of girls my 
age.﻿
comments.author: Madison Kaylor

comments.text:
I think there's no point of having a body you can't be athletic with... 
Looking overweight or obese isn't a problem, the health risks it comes with 
should be the main concern, not how "ugly" or "pretty" a human looks. Same 
thing goes for humans who are underweight or anorexic. It's not all about 
fashion, humans should also care about being healthy and athletic to an 
extent. At the end of the day, maintaining a healthy body is more 
important.﻿
comments.author: Harry Contreras

comments.text: I would break into tears. ﻿
comments.author: Arianna Paul

comments.text:
I get what people are trying to say about body image, because big or small 
fat or skinny a woman should be comfortable in her own skin. However, 
obesity isn't a body image thing. It's a health thing. In the end, people 
are going to do what they're going to do, but I feel like at a certain 
point, you should try to loose weight just so you can have a healthier 
life. Just my two cents﻿

comments.text:
Lara is just a negative Nancy. she looks perfect in literally everything 
she tried on. I wonder how much of it is bc buzzfeed told her to be (very 
biased video btw) or if it's truly just low self esteem, 
I am pretty much the same size as Candace, and I've tried on "one size fits 
most" clothes and I have to say, I've never had a problem with any of it. 
they always fit. sometimes they're an ugly cut or style, but they do fit.
I think this video just purposely picked bad examples of one size fits most 
clothes.﻿

comments.author: Anne Nong

comments.text:
Bodies are all created "equal"--they are just not created the same. We are 
preoccupied with weight, height, etc., but having weighed 250 pounds at one 
time and being overweight/obese for most of my life, I will NEVER go back 
to 250 pounds again, and not because of clothes but for health reasons.  I 
always found a wide range of clothes at that size--you just need to know 
where to shop.﻿
comments.author: gwendolyn2001

comments.text:
I think it's fine for Brandy Melville to have only small sizes. Plus size 
stores exist so why can't slim size stores exist? It is very hard for girls 
who have a small build to find clothes just like woman who and a little 
chubbier. There SHOULD be stores for different body types or else no one 
would have clothes that they feel comfortable in...﻿
comments.author: Isabel Rose

comments.text:
Ugh, I have to wear ankle high shoes, because all my pants are too short. I 
am tall and slim, with no hips or boobs, and pants either fit lengthwise 
and are too loose, or slightly short and fit. And tops designed for 
cleavage! I make a lot of clothes now, I can adjust to my size easier ﻿
